availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Veachel H. Jones (Barren County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Jones. Father of John W. Jones, S.E. Jones, Samuel J. Jones, and Amelia E. Jones. Sheriff in Edmonson County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Barren County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned four enslaved individuals in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 35B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, p. 1054.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, p. 19.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 613A.
Find A Grave, "Judge Veachel H. Jones (Nov 2, 1818-Jan 28, 1876)," Memorial #104306977, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104306977 (accessed April 24, 2020).
